title.title: Headline
title.text: Most works have a title that should be entered here verbatim. In the event the work has no title, attempt to summarize the contents in a few words without editorializing. This text is featured prominently in incident records.

authors.title: Creator of the Linked Content
authors.text: Enter the names of the creators of the linked content. Press “enter” to begin a new item.

submitters.title: This is you!
submitters.text: Enter your name here. If more than one person contributed to collecting the incident, press “enter” to begin a new item. Alternatively, you can enter "Anonymous" as submitter if you do not want to be attributed in the database. Entries in this field will be added to the public leaderboard.

incident_date.title: When did the incident first occur?
incident_date.text: Many AI incidents are not discrete events (i.e. they happen over a period of time). Further, it is often difficult to know when the incident first occured when the first public report follows some period of time after the first occurence. In this field you should enter either the date of the first report of the incident, or an educated guess of when the incident likely first occured. For instance, if the incident is pertaining to a search engine feature that launched in January and the first public incident report is in February, you should assign an incident date in January.

date_published.title: When did the report become available?
date_published.text: Reports often have a publication date at the URL, but even when it does not, you can visit the  <linkto to="https://archive.org/web/">Wayback Machine</linkto> to find when the report URL was first indexed.

date_downloaded.title: When did you copy the contents of the report into this form?
date_downloaded.text: Reports are often updated through time by news organizations. This date helps determine whether the contents could potentially be stale. Typically you will put today's date here.

url.title: Link to the publicly available report
url.text: This address will be linked to within many incident database UIs.

image_url.title: An image used to preview the incident report
image_url.text: This should be a URL for an image that will be indexed and displayed next to the report. Most publications now have headline images you can grab a URL from by right-clicking. You can also link figure images here instead.

incident_id.title: Is this an existing incident?
incident_id.text: Very often reports are written about incidents that are already in the incident database. Before submitting, you should check whether the incident is in the database already by visiting the "Discover" application and searching for incidents of a similar nature to the incident report you are now submitting. If an incident exists for your report, but the report has never been submitted, please enter the corresponding incident identifier number here. If the incident report already exists, please do not resubmit.

text.title: Text of the article or transcript of the rich media
text.text: Copy, paste, and validate the textual contents of the incident report match the contents of the URL linked above. Please scrub it of all advertisements and other media that should not be indexed and searched when users are discovering incidents in the database.

reportAddress.title: Link to the publicly available report
reportAddress.text: This address will be linked to within many incident database UIs.

tags.title: Tag the type of incident report
tags.text: The purpose of report tags is to support sorting reports on the citation page for the incident. When in doubt, you can leave this field blank and a database editor will select appropriate tags at ingestion time.

language.title: Language of the incident report
language.text: This is the written language of the text found in the report, not the language of the people or countries involved in the report. The reports will be translated to supported languages when we ingest the text.

harmed_parties.title: Alleged harmed or nearly harmed parties
harmed_parties.text: If multiple, press “enter” to begin a new item

deployers.title: Alleged deployer of AI system
deployers.text: If multiple, press “enter” to begin a new item

developers.title: Alleged developer of AI system
developers.text: If multiple, press “enter” to begin a new item

description.title: Description
description.text: A short, factual, journalistically neutral, and complete description of the incident mentioning the incident/issue, location, and harm.
